STRGenotyper.base_file_name.description: Prefix for name of all output files

STRGenotyper.cram_file.description: Input CRAM file for STR genotyping

STRGenotyper.haploid.description: Enable haploid mode: report single allele instead of diploid pairs. Use for X/Y chromosomes in males or haploid organisms.

STRGenotyper.max_repeat.description: Maximum number of repeat units to include in auxiliary reference sequences

STRGenotyper.memory_gb_override.description: Optional memory allocation override in GB (default: 16)

STRGenotyper.min_mapping_quality.description: Minimum mapping quality for reads to be included in analysis

STRGenotyper.min_repeat.description: Minimum number of repeat units to include in auxiliary reference sequences

STRGenotyper.min_score_ratio.description: Minimum ratio of alignment score to the theoretical maximum score (read_length * match_score). Alignments below this threshold are filtered out. Range: 0.0-1.0, where 1.0 requires perfect alignment.

STRGenotyper.output_detailed_csv.description: Whether to output detailed per-read CSV file. Set to false for large catalogs to reduce I/O.

STRGenotyper.output_summary_csv.description: Whether to output summary per-locus CSV file. Set to false for large catalogs to reduce I/O.

STRGenotyper.ref_padding.description: Number of bases to extend around the STR repeat region when building auxiliary references for alignment. Larger values provide more flanking sequence context for accurate alignment.

STRGenotyper.references.description: Reference genome files (fasta, fasta.fai, dict) as References struct

STRGenotyper.spanning_flank_bases.description: Minimum number of bases that must align on each side of the STR repeat region for a read to be considered 'spanning' the locus

STRGenotyper.threads.description: Number of threads for parallel processing

STRGenotyper.variant_catalog.description: JSON file containing STR variant catalog with locus definitions
